poem:
Title: Prayer for the Green Solitude

Without man's clamor, they grace the sill,
Called forth to theatre of sun's performance,
Each vessel adorned with dew-still silence.
Leaf architects in artisanal coterie,
In holy gesture of growth beguiled,
Turning themselves to the light unfiled.
No casting off of autumn's plight,
In rooms of billowing emerald light.
So keep, O Lord, your vine-bound sprite,
Within our care, but in Your sight.
